items.title: Christy Dignam
items.content:
Irish rock legend, Christy Dignam, reflects on how he has been struggling with traumas including sexual abuse and drug addiction.

And offers his twenty-something year old self advice.

items.title: Terri Hooley
items.content: Belfast's 'Godfather of Punk' Terri Hooley reflects on growing up in poverty and his relationship with his mother and father.

items.title: Tommy Sands
items.content: Folk singer and peace campaigner Tommy Sands reflects on a crossroads that he faced in his early twenties, growing up in a musical family, dealing with grief and offers advice to his younger self.

items.title: David Maxwell
items.content: BBC presenter David Maxwell joins Vinny for 'When I Was 25' to talk about his childhood, uni, faith, ambitions and a huge turning point in his life.

items.title: Foot Reading
items.content:
Celebrity foot reader Jane Sheehan explains to Vinny and guests what she can tell about their emotions and personalities, by looking at their feet.

Also - box set addictions. Are you picking box sets over intimacy?

items.title: When Vinny was 25
items.content:
To mark the 100th edition of When I Was 25, Vinny is interviewed by producer Seamus.

What advice would you give your younger self?

Lifeline: 0808 808 8000

items.title: Julian Simmons
items.content:
Broadcasting royalty, Julian Simmons shares his story in 'What I Wish I Knew at 25'.

He talks about his career, losing his parents and dealing with homophobic abuse.
